p: As the conventional and traditional energy resources are depleting, there is an increasing need to develop renewable, low-cost, and efficient power and energy sources. To satisfy the needs of modern society, supercapacitors with fast charging/discharging rates, long cycle life, and high-power density attract worldwide research and commercial attention. An electrical double-layer capacitor (EDLC) is a common device showing great potential in fast energy discharge applications. However, the low operating voltages, high leakage current, and low energy density of supercapacitors limit their applications [ 1, 2]. The degradation at the interface of electrodes and electrolytes is of a concern when raising the operation voltages [ 3, 4]. To prolong and extend the cycling life of the EDLC and battery electrodes, researchers are directing their efforts at surface modification of the electrodes as a most effective way to reach the target.
